definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: Johannesburg is also known as the economic engine of Southern Africa and the trendsetter of South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 约翰内斯堡也被称作是南非的经济的发动机和领头羊。

sentences.english: He was in Johannesburg for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 他当时在约翰内斯堡过周末。

sentences.english: Scott Baldauf contributed to this story from Johannesburg.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特道夫促成了这一从约翰内斯堡的故事。

sentences.english: South Africa's goalkeeper Itumeleng Khune trains in Johannesburg on June 7, 2010. (ALEXANDER JOE/AFP/Getty Images)
sentences.chinese: 6月7日，约翰内斯堡，南非队守门员库内在训练。

sentences.english: Roundtrip Economy class air ticket for Hong Kong and JohannesBurg on CX.
sentences.chinese: 国泰航空公司来回香港至约翰内斯堡机票。

sentences.english: The capital of Gauteng, Johannesburg, will be front-and-center during the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯期间，豪滕省首府约翰内斯堡将最的地位。

sentences.english: Baloyi works at his home in a shanty town outside Johannesburg.
sentences.chinese: Baloyi作品在他位于约翰内斯堡棚户区外的家。

sentences.english: We played one game in Johannesburg in that tournament.
sentences.chinese: 还是那届锦标赛，我们在约翰内斯堡赛过一场。

definition: Dar es Salaam (former capital of Tanzania)
pinyin: Da2 lei4 si1 Sa4 la1 mu3
Ya4 di4 si1 Ya4 bei4 ba1
